This vignette introduces the localmap compendium structure and shows how to
access configuration and the input manifest without attaching the package.

```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(comment = "#>", collapse = TRUE)
```

```{r}
# Read config and manifest using fully-qualified calls
cfg <- localmap::cfg_read()
mf  <- localmap::read_manifest(cfg$data$manifest)
mf
```

```{r}
#| eval: false
# Resolve species queries defined in metadata/species_requests.csv
requests <- localmap::read_species_requests(cfg$data$species_requests)
resolved <- localmap::ala_resolve_species(requests)
head(resolved)
```

If you've executed the pipeline (`targets::tar_make()`), you can also read
targets directly:

```{r}
# targets::tar_read(manifest_summary)
```
